title.narrative: Mechanism 17843 - USAID Caring for Vulnerable Children

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
The primary goal is to reduce vulnerability among OVC and their families by strengthening systems and structures to deliver quality services to increase resiliency through a family-centered care and support approach. This goal is aligned with core GHI principles of country ownership and sustainability through systems strengthening. The program will reach HVC and caregivers by covering regions with Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.8: Orphans and Vulnerable Children. Activities are aimed at improving the lives of orphans and other vulnerable children (OVC) affected by HIV/AIDS, and doing so in a measurable way. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.17: Pediatric Care and Support. All health facility-based care for HIV-exposed children and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.18: Treatment/Pediatric Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. objectives

The primary goal is to reduce vulnerability among OVC and their families by strengthening systems and structures to deliver quality services to increase resiliency through a family-centered care and support approach. This goal is aligned with core GHI principles of country ownership and sustainability through systems strengthening. The program will reach HVC and caregivers by covering regions with high OVC load and HIV prevalence including Amhara, Oromia, SNNPR, Addis Ababa, and Gambella. In COP15, the program will prioritize family-strengthening approaches that reinforce families’ long term caring capacity such as boosting household economic status and improving child/family access to health care and schooling. The program will build the capacity of local community structures to respond to children and families in need; strengthen the social welfare system; identify evidence-based practices through an evaluation of OVC programs’ impact; and link impact mitigation in OVC program to clinical interventions. The Performance Monitoring Plan outlines key indicators for monitoring progress against the results framework, as well as tools to ensure standardization of activities across the program and integration of consistency and quality assurance. This program relies heavily on data collected through the Child Support Index and reports tracking performance and outcomes. These data inform key program decisions and facilitate the efficient use of resources based on full knowledge of the target population’s needs. This mechanism will have a total spend amount of 3,000,000 for the period April 2016 to September 2016.

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.
